intro: Gilia ophthalmoides, commonly known as the "eye-like gilia," is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant produces showy, pink to purple flowers that resemble small eyes, hence its common name. It typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in open woodlands and grasslands. Gilia ophthalmoides is an annual herb that blooms from late spring to early summer.
